title.narrative: WASH - COMMUNITY ENVIRONMENT HIGIENIC AND SAFE

description.narrative: Strengthened national capacities for implementing sustainable and equitable Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH) programming at scale, which contributes to Sanitation, Sanitation (Covid), Water, Water (Covid). UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2021, pregnant women and new-borns, children and adolescents have equitable access to essential lifesaving health care services

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Strengthened national capacities for implementing sustainable and equitable WASH programming at scale

description.narrative: At the end of the year, 800,000 people had access to safe water thanks to WASH rehabilitations of infrastructure, supply distribution and more than 900,000 people accessed eseential information on hygiene, water treatment and storage at household level. This was achieved through the support of 14 partners and working closely with the government to align with national priorities as well as humanitarian. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:10/02/2020
